senses.sense_definition: A child, usually between the ages of 8 and 12, who is in the stage between middle childhood and adolescence.

examples.text: Marketing companies often design specific clothing lines to appeal to <w>tweens</w>.
My daughter is a <w>tween</w>, so she feels too old for dolls but too young for dating.

senses.sense_definition: A sequence of intermediate frames generated between two images in an animation to create the illusion of smooth movement.

examples.text: The animator adjusted the <w>tween</w> to ensure the character moved naturally across the screen.
Using a motion <w>tween</w> saves time because you do not have to draw every single frame by hand.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to or suitable for children aged between approximately 8 and 12.

examples.text: The store has a large section dedicated to <w>tween</w> fashion and accessories.
She writes books for a <w>tween</w> audience, focusing on friendship and school issues.

senses.sense_definition: To generate intermediate frames in an animated sequence to make the transition between two key images look smooth.

examples.text: The software automatically <w>tweens</w> the movement between the starting and ending points.
He spent several hours <w>tweening</w> the walk cycle to make it look realistic.

senses.sense_definition: A shortened form of the word 'between'.

examples.text: The secret was kept <w>tween</w> the two friends for many years.
There is a strong bond <w>tween</w> us that cannot be easily broken.
